title: Lew Evans
text:
Llewellyn John Evans (born 19 February 1881) was a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who represented <a href="Australia">Australia</a>.
Evans, a <a href="fly-half%20%28rugby%20union%29">fly-half</a>, was born in <a href="Brisbane%2C%20Queensland">Brisbane, Queensland</a>, and won three international rugby caps for Australia, his first against New Zealand, at Sydney, on 15 August 1903.
His brother, <a href="William%20Evans%20%28Australian%20sportsman%29">Poley Evans</a>, also represented Australia in the inaugural Test match of 1899.
